io.github.jonestimd.subset

Class SubsetSearch<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jonestimd.subset.SubsetSearch<T>

  • public abstract class SubsetSearch<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class finds subsets of a collection that match some criteria. The criteria are specified by an implementation of SubsetPredicate. The static factory methods can be used to create an instance of this class based on the category (uniform sign or mixed sign) of the collection.

    The subsets are searched by adding and removing items to a working subset and notifying the predicate. When an item is added to the working subset,the predicate returns a SubsetPredicateResult indicating if the current subset matches the criteria. When an item is removed from the working subset, the predicate is notified so that it can update its state. For subsets that do not meet the criteria, the predicate can return one of 3 values, to indicate how the search should proceed. The first 2 values should be used for uniform sign collections and the last value should be used for mixed sign collections.

    • SubsetPredicateResult.TOO_FEW - items should be added to the subset to move toward the goal
    • SubsetPredicateResult.TOO_MANY - items should be removed from the subset to move toward the goal
    • SubsetPredicateResult.NO_MATCH - it is unknown if items should be added or removed

    Note: This class is not thread safe and each instance should only be accessed by a single thread.

      • isEndNode

        protected abstract boolean isEndNode(SubsetPredicateResult result)
        Returns:
        true if the result indicates that supersets of the current set will not match.

      • uniformSign

        public static <T> SubsetSearch<T> uniformSign(SubsetPredicate<T> criteria)
        Create a SubsetSearch for use on a collection having uniform sign (e.g. all positive or negative numbers with no zeros). The returned instance will not consider supersets of a subset for which the predicate returns SubsetPredicateResult.MATCH or SubsetPredicateResult.TOO_MANY.

      • mixedSign

        public static <T> SubsetSearch<T> mixedSign(SubsetPredicate<T> criteria)
        Create a SubsetSearch for use on a collection having mixed sign (e.g. a mix of positive numbers, negative numbers and zeros). The returned instance will consider all possible subsets.
